item.title: Public footpath from Partridge road to Northcote Road is overgrown with vegetation and overhanging trees, 22nd February
item.description:
The Public footpath that extends from outside 37 Partridge Road to next to 88 Northcote Road is overgrown with vegetation and overhanging dead tree branches. The path which used to be at least 3ft wide is barely visible in places with most of it being unusable due to encroaching vegetation and overhanging dead trees. Having to walk on the grass which has now become a complete mudslide and is very very slippery. Only a matter of time before someone has an accident.previously I have slipped iver and my husband cut his head (reported at the time and they cane and cut the branch and left it)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Partridge Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged equipment, 22nd February
item.description:
I find it embarrassing and unsafe taking my grandchildren to the play park area in Russell Park. So much of the equipment is damaged, unsafe and unusable. The zip wire has been broken for over a year, as has one of the rocking animal seats. The rope climbing frame has been broken since June 2025, when safety tape was put round it. I watched a group of school children tear this off within half an hour (and I reported this to Bexleyheath School). My son lives in Dartford and the play facilities there are so much better and well looked after. What is our council tax being used for?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign liable to mislead, 22nd February
item.description:
